tn.text: Paul continues giving Titus instructions on how to teach the elders and people under his care in Crete.
"Tell our people again what they already know" or "Keep reminding them"

tn.ref: submit to rulers and authorities, to obey them
tn.text: "do as the political rulers and government authorities say by obeying them"
These words have similar meanings and are used together to include everyone who holds authority in the government.

tn.ref: be ready for every good work
tn.text: "be ready to do good whenever there is opportunity"
"speak evil of"

tn.ref: let other people have their way
tn.text: When personal preferences are not sinful, Paul exhorts the believers to do things the way other people prefer things done.
"Because"
"formerly" or "at some time" or "previously"
"foolish" or "unwise"

tn.ref: led astray ... by various passions and pleasures
tn.text: Paul speaks of our sinful desires as if they were people who led us off the right path. AT: "we were deceived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: enslaved by various passions and pleasures
tn.text: Paul speaks of our formerly extremely strong desires to do wrong as if they had been our slavemasters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"lusts" or "desires"
"evil" and "envy" are similar words for sin. AT: "We were always doing evil things and wanting what others have" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
"We caused others to hate us"

tn.ref: when the kindness of God our savior and his love for mankind appeared
tn.text: Paul speaks of God's kindness and love as if they were people that came into our sight. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"because he had mercy on us"

Paul is probably speaking of God's forgiveness for sinners as if he were physically washing them. He is also speaking of sinners who become responsive to God as if they had been born again. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"abundantly" or "generously"

tn.ref: poured the Holy Spirit on us
tn.text: It is common for New Testament writers to speak of the Holy Spirit as of a liquid that could be poured. AT: "gave the Holy Spirit to us generously" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:bita_phenom]])
"when Jesus saved us"
"God has declared us to be without sin"

tn.ref: we might become heirs through the confidence of eternal life
tn.text: The people to whom God has made promises are spoken of as if they were to inherit property and wealth from a family member. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to God giving the believers the Holy Spirit through Jesus in [[:en:bible:notes:tit:03:06|3:7]].

tn.ref: may be intent on the good works
tn.text: "may seek to do the good works"
Paul speaks about good deeds as if they were objects that God could place in front of people. AT: "that God prepared for them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul explains what Titus should avoid and how to treat those who cause contention among the believers.
"But you, Titus,"
"arguments concerning unimportant matters"
This is the study of family kinship relationships.
"quarreling"
"the law of Moses"
"Stay away from"
"after you have warned that person once or twice"
"a person like that"

tn.ref: has turned from the right way
tn.text: Paul speaks of someone who makes errors as if he were leaving the path on which he had been walking (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"brings judgment on himself"
Paul closes the letter by telling Titus what to do after he appoints elders in Crete and by giving greetings from those with him.
"After I send"
These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"you hurry and come" or "come quickly"
"stay for the winter"
"You hurry" or "Do not delay in sending"
"and also send Apollos"
Paul explains why it is important to provide for Zenas and Apollos.
Paul is referring to the believers in Crete.
"be busy doing"
These are important unplanned or immediate needs that were not previously made known.
This double negative means they should be fruitful or productive. AT: "so they will be fruitful" or "so that they will be productive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: so that they may not be unfruitful
tn.text: Paul speaks of good result as if they were fruit. AT: "so they will produce good results" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul ends his letter to Titus.
"All the people"

tn.ref: those who love us in faith
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "the believers who love us" or 2) "the believers who love us because we share the same belief."

tn.ref: Grace be with all of you
tn.text: This was a common Christian greeting. AT: "May God's grace be with you" or "I ask that God will be gracious to all of you"
